Authors:
Shuji Ushijima, Naoki Endo, Akiyoshi Yamada, Eiji
Nagasawa
Title:
A new species of the genus Tricholoma (Tricholomataceae,
Agaricales) from Japan
Keywords:
Basidiomycota, Evergreen broad-leaved tree, Molecular
phylogeny, Taxonomy
Abstract:
A novel species of Tricholoma section Tricholoma, T.
olivaceonigrum sp. nov. is described and illustrated from Japan. This
species is characterized by umbonate pileus, greenish olivaceous to
almost blackish pileus surface with fibrils, association with
warm-temperate evergreen broad-leaved tree, and fruiting in late autumn
to early winter. Phylogenetic analysis of internal transcribed spacer
(ITS) region of fungal ribosomal RNA gene (rDNA) showed that new species
is the sister species of T. portentosum, but morphologically distinct
each other. Other similar species, T. sejunctum and T. viridilutescens
are morphologically, ecologically, and phylogenetically distinct from T.
olivaceonigrum.
